item.title: 墨西哥央行称美国贸易关税可能削弱经济增长前景
item.description: 墨西哥央行成员认为，部分由于美国关税的不确定性，今年经济走弱的可能性较大，这种展望包含了更大的衰退可能性，但有助于抑制通胀。【原文：Mexico central bank members see odds of a weaker economy this year due in part to US tariff uncertainty, an outlook that incorporates greater chances of recession but can help tame inflation.】

item.title: 软件公司 Canva 下注新的人工智能创意产品与 Adobe 竞争
item.description: 设计软件提供商 Canva Inc. 发布了增强其人工智能生成产品的产品，在首次公开募股之际寻求吸引竞争对手 Adobe Inc. 的企业客户。【原文：Design software provider Canva Inc. unveiled products to boost its generative artificial intelligence offerings, seeking to attract corporate customers away from rival Adobe Inc. as it heads toward an initial public offering.】

item.title: 据说加拿大官员计划在特朗普投诉后与美国银行会面
item.description: 据知情人士透露，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普抱怨美国银行在加拿大开展业务遇到困难之后，加拿大政府已邀请包括摩根大通银行在内的美国银行代表举行会议。【原文：The Canadian government has invited representatives from US banks including JPMorgan Chase & Co. for a meeting, according to people with knowledge of the matter, after US President Donald Trump complained that American banks have trouble doing business in Canada.】

item.title: 雷-达里奥称关税动荡损害了美国的可靠性声誉
item.description: 桥水公司（Bridgewater Associates）的亿万富翁创始人雷-达里奥（Ray Dalio）说，本周全球市场动荡不安，给投资者留下了 "创伤、震惊或恐惧的因素"。【原文：Bridgewater Associates’ billionaire founder Ray Dalio said investors have been left with “an element of trauma or shock or fear” after all the global markets turmoil this week.】

item.title: 利洁时家庭护理产品收购方在关税忧虑下降低估值
item.description: 利洁时集团（Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc）去年开始出售家庭护理品牌组合，包括 Air Wick 和 Cillit Bang 等家喻户晓的品牌，尽管标价高达 60 亿英镑（77 亿美元），但还是吸引了众多私募股权收购者。【原文：When Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc set out last year to sell a portfolio of homecare brands, including household names such as Air Wick and Cillit Bang, it drew a bevy of private equity suitors despite a hefty £6 billion ($7.7 billion) price tag.】

item.title: 特朗普的制造业梦想与企业主的现实发生冲突
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普上周表示，他将利用关税来重塑美国的贸易政策，促进国内制造业的发展，企业家埃维塔-朱（Evita Chu）便开始四处打听，看能否将她从中国和欧洲购买的一些纱线转运到美国。【原文：When President Donald Trump said last week that he was using tariffs to remake American trade policy and bolster domestic manufacturing, entrepreneur Evita Chu started calling around to see if she could source some of the yarn she buys from China and Europe in the US instead.】

item.title: 西班牙裔消费者的压力损害了 Modelo 和 Corona 啤酒的销量
item.description: Modelo Especial 和 Corona 的销售商星座品牌公司（Constellation Brands Inc.【原文：Modelo Especial and Corona seller Constellation Brands Inc. said concern among Hispanic consumers over inflation, immigration and job security is weighing on demand for beer.】

item.title: Aptior 表示：欧洲信贷吸引投资者远离美国
item.description: 投资公司Aptior Capital称，由于担心唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战及其对经济的潜在影响，投资者正在转向欧洲不良信贷，以分散对美国的投资。【原文：Investors are turning to European distressed credits as they diversify away from the US amid concerns over Donald Trump’s trade war and its potential impact on the economy, according to investment firm Aptior Capital.】

item.title: 摩根大通分析师的 "改编 "报告道出了对特朗普的担忧
item.description: 被杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）称赞为 "我们公司最伟大的思想家之一 "的摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：A JPMorgan Chase & Co. strategist who Jamie Dimon has lauded as “one of our firm’s great thinkers” is taking an unusual approach to highlight fears on Wall Street over speaking out against the Trump administration.】

item.title: 瑞士国家银行舒丁支持现金，同时呼吁即时支付
item.description: 瑞士国家银行理事会成员 Petra Tschudin 重申了该机构对纸币的承诺，同时她还赞扬了瑞士即时支付系统的优点。【原文：Swiss National Bank Governing Board member Petra Tschudin reaffirmed her institution’s commitment to banknotes, even as she extolled the virtues of Switzerland’s instant payment system.】

item.title: 交易员应对特朗普逆转后数十年来最动荡的股票市场
item.description: 华尔街又一次惨遭逆转，这一次，标准普尔 500 指数下跌 5%，抹去了周三历史性涨幅的一半，这暴露了投资者在试图驾驭现代史上最不连贯的贸易政策时所面临的困难。【原文：Another brutal reversal on Wall Street, this one a 5% rout in the S&P 500 that wiped out half of Wednesday’s historic gains, has laid bare the difficulties facing investors trying to navigate one of the least coherent trade policies in modern history.】

item.title: 油价暴跌暂时不会打破普京的战争机器
item.description: 最近的油价暴跌不会改变俄罗斯为其战争机器提供资金的能力，因为非能源行业收入的增加和雨天储备有助于抵消损失。【原文：The recent plunge in oil prices won’t be a game changer for Russia’s ability to finance its war machine as rising revenue from non-energy sectors and rainy-day reserves help offset losses.】

item.title: 特朗普表示不希望日本成为美国钢铁业东家后，美国钢铁业下跌 10
item.description: 美国钢铁公司股价创下两个月来的最大跌幅，此前一天，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普重申了他的一贯立场，即他不希望看到这家钢铁制造商被日本公司所拥有。【原文：United States Steel Corp. shares posted their biggest drop in two months, a day after US President Donald Trump reiterated his long-held position that he doesn’t want to see the steelmaker owned by a Japanese company.】

item.title: 贸易战愈演愈烈，特朗普对中国征收的关税至少已达 145
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统对中国进口商品征收的关税目前至少已达 145%。【原文：President Donald Trump’s tariffs on Chinese imports are now at least 145%.】

item.title: 特朗普关税促使私人借贷机构对投资组合进行分级
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的全面性全球关税措施即将生效的前几天，私人信贷经理们都低着头，试图评估其投资组合所受到的影响。【原文：In the days before US President Donald Trump’s sweeping global tariffs were set to go into effect, private credit managers had their heads down, trying to assess the impact to their portfolios.】

item.title: NTT 加入人工智能芯片竞赛，瞄准无人机拍摄技术
item.description: 日本电信电话公司（Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp.）表示，它已开发出一种可帮助无人机处理高分辨率视频的芯片，这表明这家国家支持的公司将把更多资源投入到人工智能领域。【原文：Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp. said it’s developed a chip that can help drones process high-resolution videos, a sign of more resources from the state-backed company going into artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 瑞典因涉嫌代理冲突罢免最高金融监管机构
item.description: 在因明显的利益冲突而引发持续骚动之后，瑞典政府重新任命了该国金融监管机构的负责人，以确保人们对该监管机构的持续信任。【原文：Sweden’s government reassigned the head of the country’s financial watchdog to ensure continued trust in the regulator after a continued uproar over an apparent conflict of interest.】

item.title: 拜朱的美国贷款人因现金丢失起诉创始人、妻子和高级助手
item.description: 美国贷款机构在美国破产法院起诉了备受争议的印度科技企业家拜朱-拉文德兰（Byju Raveendran）和他的妻子，要求他们为逾 5 亿美元的贷款收益损失承担个人责任。【原文：American lenders sued controversial Indian tech entrepreneur Byju Raveendran and his wife in a US bankruptcy court, seeking to hold them personally responsible for more than $500 million in missing loan proceeds.】

item.title: 波利耶夫尔将推动各城市削减新房建设税费
item.description: 保守党领袖皮埃尔-波利耶夫尔（Pierre Poilievre）宣布了一项计划，推动各城市削减加拿大新房建设的开发费用。【原文：Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre announced a plan to push cities to cut development charges on new home construction in Canada.】

item.title: 英国央行布里登称英镑走软带来通胀风险
item.description: 英国央行副行长萨拉-布里登（Sarah Breeden）表示，决策者正在关注英镑的潜在走软，以寻找如何应对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普贸易战的迹象。【原文：Bank of England Deputy Governor Sarah Breeden said policymakers are monitoring a potential weakening in the pound for signs of how to respond to US President Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 美联储施密德表示 "正视 "通胀风险
item.description: 堪萨斯城联邦储备银行行长杰夫-施密德（Jeff Schmid）表示，如果美国央行行长们被迫在物价稳定目标和充分就业任务之间寻求平衡，他将优先考虑抑制通胀。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City President Jeff Schmid said he would prioritize reining in inflation if US central bankers are forced to balance their price stability goal against their mandate for full employment.】

item.title: 美属维尔京群岛因历史原因免征关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统试图重新调整全球贸易秩序，美属维尔京群岛正抓住这一机遇，努力利用其在美国的独特地位。【原文：The US Virgin Islands is eyeing an opportunity to benefit from President Donald Trump’s dramatic attempt to reorder global trade by trying to exploit its unique status within the US.】

item.title: 凯捷与 WNS 就收购事宜进行深入谈判
item.description: 据知情人士透露，凯捷公司（Capgemini SE）正在就收购外包公司 WNS Holdings Ltd. 进行深入谈判。【原文：Capgemini SE is in advanced talks to acquire outsourcing company WNS Holdings Ltd., people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 凯尔-巴斯称美国可能需要经济衰退来重建基础
item.description: 凯尔-巴斯（Kyle Bass）说，美国可能需要经历一次经济衰退，因为它要重新调整全球贸易关系，并试图控制联邦赤字。【原文：Kyle Bass said the US may need to undergo a recession as it reorders its global trade ties and attempts to rein in the federal deficit.】

item.title: 全球经济衰退风险成为巴西经济团队的首要担忧
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的政府官员表示，贸易战引发的全球经济衰退已成为巴西经济团队的基本设想，该团队目前正在评估贸易战对经济增长、通货膨胀和利率的影响。【原文：A global recession stemming from the trade war has become the base-case scenario for Brazil’s economic team, which is now assessing its impact on growth, inflation and interest rates, according to a government official familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 洛根称美联储必须确保关税不会引发持久通胀
item.description: 达拉斯联邦储备银行行长洛里-洛根（Lorie Logan）表示，官员们必须确保关税引发的通胀不会变得更加持久，并警告说，在美国最近发生的通胀之后，美国人对未来物价增长的预期可能会变得脆弱。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Lorie Logan said officials must ensure any tariff-induced inflation doesn’t become more permanent, warning that Americans’ expectations for future price growth may be vulnerable following the country’s latest bout of inflation.】

item.title: 特朗普关税政策逆转后，市政债券大幅反弹
item.description: 国家和地方政府债券在连续三天暴跌后，周四跳涨反弹。【原文：State and local government bonds jumped Thursday in a rebound rally, which followed three straight days of plummeting prices.】

item.title: 特朗普的威胁使加拿大与美国的关系紧张，加拿大汽车赴美次数骤降 32
item.description: 随着两国关系日趋紧张，加拿大游客正与美国保持距离，而美国曾是他们的首选目的地。【原文：Canadian travelers are keeping their distance from the US, a country that was once their top destination, as tensions between the two nations grow.】
